titles.title: Shingeki! Kyojin Chuugakkou
進撃! 巨人中学校 attack on titan: junior high
Attack on Titan: Junior High
L`Attaque Des Titans Junior High-School
进击! 巨人中学校

similaranime.anime: Naruto Sugoi Doryoku: Rock Lee no Seishun Full-Power Ninden

recommendations.recommendation: A cheap offspin for diehard fans of the show. If you like the characters and fancy yourself a school comedy, this might be for you, otherwise you must wait for another season of main show.

anime.description: Your favorite characters from Attack on Titan are back in... junior high school? Adapted from the hit spinoff manga series Attack on Titan: Junior High (written by http://anidb.net/cr43473 [Nakagawa Saki]), this parody reimagines http://anidb.net/ch76575 [Eren], http://anidb.net/ch76586 [Mikasa], http://anidb.net/ch76572 [Armin], and other characters from the original manga as students and teachers at Titan Junior High School. Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: super deformed
tag.description: A caricature style often seen in anime when the character shows extreme emotions, like fear, anger, happiness, surprise, or shame. Seen as cute, as part of humorous comedy. The character`s http://anidb.net/t4055 [face suddenly turns into a simplified version], the body will usually also deform into that of a small child (oversized head, short limbs, extra-large tears).

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: funny expressions
tag.description: The facial expressions of the characters may change so quickly or unexpectedly distort that hilarity will ensue.

episode.title: 清掃! 巨人中学校
Cleanup! Titan Junior High School
Nettoyage ! Le collège des titans
Seisou! Kyojin Chuugakkou
episode.summary: Eren and the gang reluctantly go to their first club activities at the Wall Cleanup Club. The president of the club tells them that the survival of the club depends on them and orders them to clean all the windows in school as their first activity. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闘球! 巨人中学校
Dodgeball! Titan Junior High School
Duel au ballon ! Le collège des titans
Toukyuu! Kyojin Chuugakkou
episode.summary: Because of Eren, Annie feels embarrassed about her favorite food, cheese Hamburg steak, so she gets angry and vows to defeat him at the dodgeball tournament. On the day of the tournament, though, he oversleeps and causes problems for his team. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 追跡! 巨人中学校
Chasing! Titan Junior High School
Recherche ! Le collège des titans
Tsuiseki! Kyojin Chuugakkou
episode.summary: Eren’s homeroom teacher tells him that he needs to go collect the club admission form from Armin Arlelt who has been absent from school. On his way to Armin’s house with Mikasa, they encounter an upperclassman who defeats a Titan with a single blow. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 入学! 巨人中学校
Starting School! Titan Junior High School
La rentrée au collège des titans
Nyuugaku! Kyojin Chuugakkou
episode.summary: On the very first day of junior high, Eren oversleeps and is woken up by Mikasa. While rushing to school, he runs into several of his classmates. When they arrive at school, everyone except Eren notices something is odd. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怪談! 巨人中学校
Spine-Chiller! Titan Junior High School
Histoire de fantômes ! Le collège des titans
Kaidan! Kyojin Chuugakkou
episode.summary: The Attack Junior High Scout Regiment holds a customary event called the Test of Courage. It sounds simple enough, participants just have to visit three classrooms in order and write their names on the board. At night, of course. Nothing to be scared of. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 対決! 巨人中学校
Showdown! Titan Junior High School
Confrontation ! Le collège des titans
Taiketsu! Kyojin Chuugakkou
episode.summary: Fed up with their upperclassmen’s lectures and unreasonable rules posed on them, some of the Year 1 students go against their upperclassmen. Responding to their attitude, Levi suggests settling the matter by competing in the Sports Day games. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋文! 巨人中学校
Love Letter! Titan Junior High School
Lettre d`amour ! Le collège des titans
Koibumi! Kyojin Chuugakkou
episode.summary: Someone put a love letter in Jean’s shoe locker. Since the letter isn’t signed, he doesn’t know who it’s from, so he starts trying to figure out who wrote the letter. Will Jean finally get the sweet love life he’s longed for? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 猛勉! 巨人中学校
Studying Hard! Titan Junior High School
Études acharnées ! Le collège des titans
Mouben! Kyojin Chuugakkou
episode.summary: The results of the mid-term exam are in and Mr. Keith tells his students that those who failed the tests will have to take makeup tests the following week. Those who fail again will have to take refresher classes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 進撃! 巨人中学校
Attack! Titan Junior High School
Attaque ! Le collège des titans
Shingeki! Kyojin Chuugakkou
episode.summary: After their chee-burg stand was taken by Titans, Eren and the gang decide to fight back. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 快晴! 巨人中学校
Clear and Sunny! Titan Junior High School
Beau temps ! Le collège des titans
Kaisei! Kyojin Chuugakkou
episode.summary: Year 1 Class 4 is running a cheeseburger stand in their school festival. Their neighbor is last year’s winner, the Kamameshi stand, run by Rico’s class. Though it’s a tough battle, Eren’s class is neck and neck with them. Who’ll be this year’s winner? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 推薦! 巨人中学校
Recommendation! Titan Junior High School
Recommandation ! Le collège des titans
Suisen! Kyojin Chuugakkou
episode.summary: Removal of the student council president results in an election for president. In order to win, candidates fight for a Newspaper Club member’s notebook that Levi says has information all the Attack Junior High School students would want to know. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 甘夏! 巨人中学校
Sweet Summer! Titan Junior High School
Un doux été ! Le collège des titans
Amanatsu! Kyojin Chuugakkou
episode.summary: The summer festival is coming up soon and Bertholdt asks Annie to come along. Knowing how Bertholdt feels about Annie, Reiner and Ymir try to help Bertholdt look good in front of Annie so that he can win her love. Source: crunchyroll
